required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BIBW 2992 and Letrozole in Hormonoresistant Metastatic Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study of BIBW 2992 Administration in Patients With Hormone Refractory Metastatic Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Progression-free rate after 16 weeks of BIBW 2992 administration in association with letrozole

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Progression Free Participants After 16 Weeks of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Progression was defined according to 1 of the following criteria: New bone lesion(s) on bone scan or on magnetic resonance imaging; Progression or occurrence of new lesion(s) according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumours version 1.0 (RECIST); an increase in tumour marker CA 15.3 of more than 20 percent,compared with baseline, at 2 consecutive examinations; occurrence of disease-related skeletal events. If a patient did not fulfil any criteria and was withdrawn because of clinical deterioration amounting to PD according to the Investigator, they were considered as having PD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Confirmed Objective Response (OR)
secondary_outcome.description: OR was defined as complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) and was assessed according to RECIST criteria regardless of treatment status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinical Benefit (CB)
secondary_outcome.description: CB was defined as CR, PR or stable disease (SD) and was assessed according to RECIST criteria regardless of treatment status.
The time to OR was the duration from the first treatment to the time when the measurement criteria for CR and/or PR were met according to RECIST criteria.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First occurence or OR till progression or death
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of confirmed OR is measured from the time of first OR to the time of progression or death (or date of censoring for progression free survival).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline till progression, death or data cut-off (04 Jan 2010)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from the first treatment to the occurrence of tumour progression or death, whichever came first. Progression was assessed according to RECIST criteria.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline till progression, death or data cut-off
secondary_outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from first treatment to death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under Curve of Afatinib Over a Uniform Dosing Interval Tau at Steady State (AUCtau,ss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.05 hours (h) before dosing and 2h, 4h, 6h, 8h and 24h after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: AUCtau,ss represents the area under the concentration curve of afatinib in plasma over a uniform dosing interval tau at steady state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Concentration of Afatinib in Plasma at Steady State (Cmax,ss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.05 hours (h) before dosing and 2h, 4h, 6h, 8h and 24h after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax,ss represents the maximum measured concentration of afatinib in plasma at steady state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-dose Concentration of Afatinib in Plasma at Steady State on Day 57 (Cpre,ss,57)
secondary_outcome.description: Cpre,ss,57 represents the pre-dose concentration of afatinib in plasma at steady state on day 57.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-dose Concentration of Afatinib in Plasma at Steady Stateon Day 85 (Cpre,ss,85)
secondary_outcome.description: Cpre,ss,85 represents the pre-dose concentration of afatinib in plasma at steady state on day 85.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time From Dosing to the Maximum Concentration of Afatinib in Plasma at Steady State (Tmax,ss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.05 hours (h) before dosing and 2h, 4h, 6h, 8h and 24h after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: tmax,ss represents the time from dosing to the maximum concentration of afatinib in plasma at steady state

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under Curve of Letrozole Over a Uniform Dosing Interval Tau at Steady State (AUCtau,ss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.05 hours (h) before dosing and 2h, 4h, 6h, 8h and 24h after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: AUC0-tau,ss represents the area under the concentration curve of letrozole in plasma over a uniform dosing interval tau at steady state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Concentration of Letrozole in Plasma at Steady State (Cmax,ss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.05 hours (h) before dosing and 2h, 4h, 6h, 8h and 24h after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax,ss represents the maximum measured concentration of letrozole in plasma at steady state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time From Dosing to the Maximum Concentration of Letrozole in Plasma at Steady State (Tmax,ss)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.05 hours (h) before dosing and 2h, 4h, 6h, 8h and 24h after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: tmax,ss represents the time from dosing to the maximum concentration of letrozole in plasma at steady state.
Change from baseline in Ca15.3 tumor marker levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Change From Baseline in ECOG Performance Status
secondary_outcome.description: Best change from baseline in ECOG (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group) performance status. ECOG is measured as score between 0 (fully active) and 5 (dead). Improvement is a decrease in ECOG score from baseline of at least 1. Deterioration is an increase in ECOG score from baseline of at least 1

arm_group.description: To study BIBW 2992 in association with letrozole in hormonoresistant metastatic breast cancer

intervention.description: BIBW 2992 at high and medium dosages
BIBW 2992 at high and medium dosages

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Female patients with histologically proven breast adenocarcinoma
- Presence of metastatic disease No more than 2 prior chemotherapy regimens for metastatic disease, which could include trastuzumab Patients must currently be on letrozole and developed acquired resistance as defined by disease progression on letrozole following previous response (partial response or better, stable disease superior or equal to 24 weeks)
Diagnosis of disease progression inferior or equal to 6 weeks prior to trial entrydefined as:
1. Increase in the number of bone lesions on bone scan or on MRI AND/OR
2. Increased pain in an area of known bony metastasis AND superior or equal to 2 serial elevations in CA 15.3 AND/OR
3. Progression according to RECIST criteria on CT scan, MRI, or x-ray Patients must have documented menopause confirmed by estradiol level inferior to 11 pg/ml
Exclusion criteria:
- Premenopausal patients
- Rapidly progressive disease in major organs (i.e. lymphangitic spread in the lung and/or bulky liver metastasis) Patient with brain metastasis Significant cardiovascular diseases Previous treatment with an EGFR and/or HER-2 inhibiting drug(patients who received trastuzumab with chemotherapy but not with letrozole can be enrolled)

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: According to the protocol the starting dose of Afatinib was 50mg/day. This dose was reduced according to the protocol to first 40mg/day and then to 30mg/day due to skin toxicity.

group.title: Afatinib 50 mg With Letrozole
group.description: Patients received continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 50 mg therapy with letrozole 2.5 mg over 28-day treatment cycles until further disease progression.

group.title: Afatinib 40 mg With Letrozole
group.description: Patients received continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 40 mg therapy with letrozole 2.5 mg over 28-day treatment cycles until further disease progression.

group.description: Patients received continuous daily dosing with Afatinib 30 mg therapy with letrozole 2.5 mg over 28-day treatment cycles until further disease progression.

outcome.population: TS. Median time to RECIST tumour response was not calculable as there was no OR observed.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
